text: Oldham is a town in the North West of England. It is to the north-east of Manchester. It is part of Greater Manchester. Oldham was part of Lancashire until 1 April 1974. There were riots in Oldham in May 2001. It is the centre of the Borough of Oldham. Oldham Council achieved dubious notoriety in 2009 when in ran up a bill of Â£8 million carrying out a failed prosecution of kitchen tycoon Vance Miller. The Judge threw out the case and lambasted the council for the frivolity of the prosecution. The town has an association football team, called Oldham Athletic. It also has a cricket club, called Oldham Cricket Club. The composer, William Walton was born in Oldham. The first test tube baby, Louise Joy Brown, was born in Oldham General Hospital on 25 July 1978. == Schools == * The Blue Coat School * Crompton House * Hulme Grammar School * Saddleworth School == Other websites == * Oldham Council
